name: Tora Bora
description: Tora Bora is an almost pure indica strain with powerfully heavy effects meant for high-tolerance cannabis veterans. Named after the region near the Afghanistan-Pakistan border, DNA Genetics bred this 99% indica strain by combining L.A. Confidential and X18 Pure Pakistani. The result is a resin-loaded, spicy-smelling indica that can appear almost blue in its coloration. Few strains will deliver better relief for pain and insomnia, and recreational consumers will enjoy the intensity of Tora Bora as long as no plans are made to leave the house. Tora Bora finishes its vegetative cycle quickly and flowers in just a short 8 to 9 weeks indoors.
descriptionPlain: Tora Bora is an almost pure indica strain with powerfully heavy effects meant for high-tolerance cannabis veterans. Named after the region near the Afghanistan-Pakistan border, DNA Genetics bred this 99% indica strain by combining L.A. Confidential and X18 Pure Pakistani. The result is a resin-loaded, spicy-smelling indica that can appear almost blue in its coloration. Few strains will deliver better relief for pain and insomnia, and recreational consumers will enjoy the intensity of Tora Bora as long as no plans are made to leave the house. Tora Bora finishes its vegetative cycle quickly and flowers in just a short 8 to 9 weeks indoors.

highlightedReviews.text:
Initial impression: I saw this strain sitting in its glass jar with almost an oily bluish sheen to it. Come to find out it was such dark blue and purple that the light being bounced off gave this strain an oily sheen to it, kinda neat if you ask me. I was excited to see a strain with such varying phenotype distinctiveness and displays. My initial impression was of some wonder and a little marveling over the aesthetics of this strain.

I use a scale of 10 points, 10 being the highest possible score in any category, with 3 total categories, Taste / Aroma / Potency.

Aroma: 5.5
The aroma is reminiscent of a light piney, spicy, earthy pungent-ness. The aroma was okay, was really light ans subtle, which was nice. Nothing really special.

Taste: 7.5
The taste of this bud was something quite different than its scent. Like the aroma, the taste was also light.  The initial taste of this is more earthy and piney than its smell leads you to believe. The taste of this bud was okay, left me wanting more flavor. I am not saying this is bad, I am also not impressed, this strain was okay for a middle of the week night toke.

Potency: 7.0
The strength of this euphoria was like everything else about this strain just okay. This strain had a THC rating in the high teens, either I am smoking way to much and can't really feel feelings anymore, or this was a weaker plant. Ill try it again just to make sure it was a fluke.


Final opinion: I thought this strain was just okay. This is one of those strains that is average. I have read the genetic info based on this Indica cross, and was thinking that with genetics from which this plant hails, it was the runt of the littler (just my thought). This is an okay strain to take part in as a newbie.

Total points awarded: 20 out of 30 better than average but far from awesome.

CM~
This strain while powerful was extremely effective for dealing with pain.

articles.title: The 2015 Denver Cannabis Cup Winners
articles.author: Bailey Rahn
articles.text:
This year's High Times Cannabis Cup winners are in! Check out all the winners from the 2015 Cannabis Cup, which took place over the weekend before 4/20 in Denver, Colorado.
 
   Best U.S. Sativa Flower
1st Place: Ghost Train Haze #13 by Greenway Las Vegas
2nd Place: Veganic Strawberry Cough by Buds & Roses of LA
3rd Place: Green Crack by Christopher Stine
 
   Best Colorado Sativa Flower
1st Place: Ghost Train Haze by Greenman Cannabis
2nd Place: Sweet Silver Haze by Rocky Mountain High
3rd Place: Pootie Tang by Starbuds
 
   Best U.S. Indica Flower
1st Place: Granddaddy Purple by Herbal Healing
2nd Place: Kosher Kush by Greenwolf LA with Kushco
3rd Place: DaVinci OG by Greenwolf LA with Ghost Crow
 
   Best Colorado Indica Flower
1st Place: Louie XIII by Greenman Cannabis
2nd Place: Colorado Bubba by MMJ America Boulder
3rd Place: Black Fire by Docs Apothecary and the Ethos Collective
 
   Best U.S Hybrid Flower
1st Place: T.S.T. Cookies by Greenwolf and Top Shelf Terps
2nd Place: Cali Kush Farms Emperor Cookie Dough by Greenwolf LA
3rd Place: Mega Wellness OG by The Weed, The Wellness Earth Energy Dispensary with Nameless Genetics
 
   Best Colorado Hybrid Flower
1st Place: Kong by Allgreens
2nd Place: Starkiller by Greenman Cannabis
3rd Place: OG KB Cookies by MMJ America Downtown
 
   Best Sativa Concentrate
1st Place: Strawberry Lemonade Live Resin by Crockett Family Farms/Dabblicious Extracts
2nd Place: Wonderland Live Resin by Greenwolf LA with Dabblicious, Crockett Family Farm, and G.C. Rebellion Farms
3rd Place: Tangie #17 by Gold Coast Extracts
 
   Best Indica Concentrate
1st Place: Crown OG Sugar by Greenwolf LA/Nature's Lab Extracts/Crown OG
2nd Place: Space Valley OG (Fresh Frozen) by Pink House with Incredibles
3rd Place: Kush Company OG Live Resin Batter by Kush Company with Nature's Lab Extracts and the W.E.E.D. Studio City
 
   Best Hybrid Concentrate
1st Place: B Mega Wellness OG by Nameless Genetics with The Weed of Studio City
2nd Place: Crown OG Crumble by Greenwolf LA/Nature's Lab Extracts/Crown OG
3rd Place: Skywalker OG Kush by Dab Vader/Vader Extracts
 
   Best Non-Solvent Hash
1st Place: Cookies and Cream Cubantech Drysift by Exotic Genetix
2nd Place: Strawberry Banangieland 120-73u by Trichome Heavy Extracts with G.C. Rebellion Farms, Greenwolf LA, and DNA
3rd Place: Kimbo Kush Cubantech Drysift by Cuban Hash Queen with Exotic Genetix
 
   Best CBD Flower
1st Place: Tora Bora by MMJ America
2nd Place: The Nubia by Aficionado / FreeBorn Selections
3rd Place: Sleeping Giant by Elemental Seeds
 
   Best CBD Concentrate
1st Place: OG Tonic by The Smokers Club with Garden of Weedn
2nd Place: Cannatonic by Natural Mystic Cannabis Caregivers
3rd Place: Industrial Hemp CBD Extract by ISODIOL S.A.
 
   People's Choice
1st Place: Cindy White by the Green Solution
2nd Place: GRiZ Kush by Native Roots
3rd Place: Bubba Kush by The Clinic Colorado

articles.title: New Strains Alert: Phantom OG, Kaia Kush, Afghan Haze, Bay Dream, and Tora Bora
articles.author: Bailey Rahn
articles.text:
Have you ever browsed the Leafly strain database only to discover we haven't added your strain yet? Tell us so! We've added several new strains this week as per the request of our users, so be sure to check out our new indicas, sativas, and hybrids. OG fans, rejoice: Phantom OG is a flavorful indica strain said to be related to the "Planetary" series which includes Earth OG, Jupiter OG, Mars OG, and others. Our new sativa-dominant hybrids are Kaia Kush from Apothecary Genetics and Afghan Haze from Mr. Nice Seeds. Bay Dream combines two famous sativa strains, Blue Dream and Bay 11, and those who prefer indica strains will appreciate DNA Genetics' Tora Bora, which unites Afghani and Pakistani features.
These newcomers are in need of reviews, so remember to share your thoughts if you've had the pleasure of trying one of these strains!
   1. Phantom OG
Characteristics of Phantom OG:

Indica-dominant strain
Contains OG Kush genetics
Pine, lemon, and menthol aroma
Euphoric, giggly, and focused effects followed by sleepiness
May help with insomnia, pain, appetite loss, and arthritis

   2. Kaia Kush
Characteristics of Kaia Kush:

60% sativa-dominant hybrid
Cross between OG Kush and Super Silver Haze
Breeder: Apothecary Genetics
Earthy, spicy aroma
Delivers creative, functional, and relaxing effects
May help with pain, appetite loss, depression, and fatigue
Indoor flowering time of 9 to 10 weeks

   3. Afghan Haze
Characteristics of Afghan Haze:

Sativa-dominant hybrid
Cross between Afghani and Haze
Breeder: Mr. Nice Seeds
Sweet, earthy, lemon aroma
Provides energizing cerebral invigoration with soothing full-body effects
Good for pain, depression, and appetite loss
Indoor flowering time of 10 weeks

   4. Bay Dream
Characteristics of Bay Dream:

80% sativa
Cross between Blue Dream and Bay 11
Breeder: Granddaddy Purp
Pine, lemon aroma
Brings cerebrally-focused euphoria as well as fast-paced, active effects
May help patients with appetite loss

   5. Tora Bora
Characteristics of Tora Bora:

99% indica
Cross between L.A. Confidential and X18 Pure Pakistani
Breeder: DNA Genetics
Spicy aroma
Delivers intense euphoric and full-body effects
May help patients with pain and insomnia
Indoor flowering time of 8 to 9 weeks
